confirmed_facts: On 24 November 2025, President Yoon Sukâ€‘yeol and President Recep Tayyip ErdoÄŸan signed three MOUs covering veteransâ€™ welfare, nuclear cooperation, and road PPP projects.

The nuclear MOU specifies collaboration on reactor technology, site assessment, regulation, licensing, financing, business models, and project implementation, aimed at preparing South Korea for participation in Turkeyâ€™s Sinop 2 nuclear plant.

The road PPP MOU involves Turkeyâ€™s General Directorate of Highways (KGM), Korea Expressway Corporation (KEC), and Korea International Development & Overseas Infrastructure Development Agency (KIND) to jointly identify and promote PPP road projects in third countries.

timeline.event: South Korean President Yoon Sukâ€‘yeol visits Ankara and signs three MOUs with President ErdoÄŸan.
MOU on veteransâ€™ welfare signed, focusing on exchange of welfare support experiences.
Nuclear MOU signed, establishing a joint working group for Sinop 2 nuclear plant collaboration.
Road PPP MOU signed, creating a framework for joint PPP road project development in third countries.
